Linus opens up about why LMG shares so much internal information, despite the backlash it sometimes brings. From the "Trust Me Bro" warranty to missteps in communication, the team reflects on the power (and pain) of transparency. Plus, an update on Terren’s two years at LMG and a half-joking pitch for “Sebastians," the Canadian coffee chain we apparently need.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/live/WFeFGj-f5CA?si=rt5zPBllJKMxTc7o

title: Why does Linus share so much internal information?

If LMG somehow makes it to 100 years old, what would success even look like? Linus and Luke talk about legacy, ownership, and the idea of LMG lasting long after they’re gone. Plus, Linus shares a behind-the-scenes look at how his son is dipping his toes into tech reviewing, with a Kindle of all things.

Blue Origin’s latest spaceflight featured an all-female crew including Katy Perry, Gail King, and Lauren Sánchez, stirring both admiration and controversy. Linus and Luke weigh in on the public’s reaction, conspiracy theories, and whether sending celebrities to space is a publicity stunt or something more meaningful.
